text: Bottle at Delirium Brussels. It pours clear golden with a medium white head. The nose is sweet, tangy, apple, pear, ice tea and a touch of barnyard. The taste is tangy apple, pear, light acidic quality, barnyard, citrus peel and dried fruits (raisin etc) with a dry, tangy finish. Light-medium body and moderate carbonation. As faros go this aint too bad. As well as the sweet apple notes there is also light tartness and acidity. OK.

Thanks for sharing erzengel! Pours a clear copper color with a tiny loose head. The smell is apple juice, some mild sourness, a bit of caramel. The taste is definitely apple juice, some fruity tartness, a hint of caramel ending a bit dry. The body is light/medium with mild and fine carbonation.

37,5cl corked bottle, BB 02/05/14. Bought at the Tourist-Info in Brussels in November 2012  Fruity and tart in the nose, colour is reddish brown. The beer starts quite sweet. Tartness and horse blanket in the background. Highly drinkable. The mainpart is mild, smooth. Fruity woody hints together with a nice tart sourness and some horse blanket. Hints of sour apple juice. The aftertaste is long, woody, tart, sweet-sour, apples.  Nice Faro, but for me the 10% of apples in this beer is too dominant in taste. --> 9/12/8/9

Bottle 375ml. corked @ [ pre-TSODRBSG13 ], Ulfborg.Clear medium orange yellow colour with a small to average, frothy, fair lacing, mostly lasting - diminishing, off-white to white head. Aroma is sugar, marzipan malt, apples - wrinkled apples. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and light acidic with a long duration, tart, apples - wrinkled apples, sugary. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to flat. [20130830]
Light brown coloured, light hazy. Has a white head, diminishing. Flavor is heavy sweet, with faint orange/citrus notes. Acid too. Syrupy.
Bottle at TSODRBSG 13. Golden colour with a small white head. Aroma is sugar, yeast, malt, almond. Flavour is sugar, yeast, malt, almond. Nice beer.
Bottle @ Danish Summer Gathering, 2013. Cloudy yellow body with a tiny white head Sweet, dust, grain, almond.
old barnyard aroma,golden, hazy, white foam, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly sour, malty sweet fizzi vinegar finish.
Bottle. Frothy white fair mostly deminishing head, Dark yellow colour. Light bitter flavor. Exstremely sweet. Week orange notes. Light bitter finish. Oily palate. Way too sweet.
Bottle @ Danish Summer Gathering, 2013. Pours unclear amber with a small white head. Tart nose. Dust, almond, grain and berries. Dry finish.

Sampled @ RB Danish Summer Gathering 2013 day 1, Ulfborg. Bottle. Clear golden color with a slight orangy hue, small white head. Aroma and taste are sweet and thats basically it.Sweet, honey, slightly apricot. Meh..
Bottle, 4%. Slightly hazy golden with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, yeast, little barnyard, fruit and a litle caramel?. Flavour is malt, yeast, little sour, sweet and little candy.
Bottle. Nice head with medium duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are sugar, sweet malt, leather, funk and hops.

Bottle, bought @ the webshop. Pours clear copper with a staying, creamy, white head. Aroma has mild funk, citrus, sugar, light wheat. Medium prickly carbonation, fine dry and fairly fat mouthfeel. Flavour has firm tartness at the beginning, light citric, a bit of vinegar. Then turns sweet and sugary. Quite a fine faro overall.

Wow, fancy name (Brusselicious Lambicus). Bottle consumed at Delirium Café. The corked and caged green glass 37.5cl bottle poured out with a crystal clear copper body showing off gold edges and supporting a creamy white head of foam. The aroma offers up inviting funky barnyard that quickly mixes with sweet apple sauce and cereal graininess and coming off in a not too inviting way, that I cant really puts words to. Too contrived maybe. The taste begins with a quick little kick of sugar sweetness, apple sweetness and then heading into all too faint barnyard funkiness. It gets apple sugar sweet to midway and then a carbonation enhanced prickly dryness intercedes toward the finish. Decent but on the overly sweet side.

375 ml bottle. 2012 vintage. BB 09/11/13. From finestshop.be.
Clear deep golden colour with tiny white head.
Aroma is rather sweet with sugar. Quite simple. 
Flavour is sugary sweetness, some fruitiness (apples and pears) and mild tartness. 
Even if this is very sweet I kind of like this. Its not mind blowing but pretty tasty anyway. Lots of pears in flavour.

On tap at Delirium Tap House, Brussels.  Clear amber, headless.  Looks, smells and tastes rather like apple juice with a hint of lemon citrus and vanilla.  Perhaps some ice tea in there too.  Certainly nothing like you expect beer to taste.  Smooth and enjoyable though and some relief from the monster ABVs consumed over the last 48 hours.

From tap at Delerium. Pours clear and golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma is sweet, citric and light fruity. Flavour sweetinitially, light citric following. Dry and lingering fruity sweet impression into the finish.

Draught at Little Delirium, Brussels. Golden beer with a offwhite head. Floral and yeasty aroma, a bit vinous. Caramell, fruity, figs, raisins, sweet and vinous flavour. Nice sweet beerwith a good balance.

Draught at Little Delirium, Brussels. Bready yeasty aroma, sweet, mash, floral notes. Caramel flavor, fruity, apples, grapes, pear, toffee, vinous, figs, raisins. Sweet but not too sweet. Fruity caramel finish with grapes and pears.
Bottle @ Delirium Cafe. Clear amber with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, candy sugar and tart. Flavor is quite sweet and light acidic finish. Sweet finish. 180712

thx to ajax25g // 25 cl. draft from Delirium Tap House // almost clear, class book amber with little lambic-y head // aroma is not that strong really, white sugar sweet, caramel, sweet tartness // taste is sweet, on the lighter side of sparkling apple juice mixed with oodles of white sugar, touch caramel, touch sweet tartness in the back but you are not going to get any lambic characteristic out of this beer // drinks as easily as juice // this is basically a sweetened cider or at least that is how this tastes like // not per see beer given that the sweeteners dominate any and all lambic flavours but it is quite delicious & drinkable // It is an alcopop but a very good one, I will never consider this to be a lambic but faro is a nonsense style // if faro is a style than lime-beers should be as well

Draft @ Delirium.
Dorée claire sur une pointe foncée, col blanc épais.
Arôme reste très doux sucré avec ce bouquet de pomme caramel, léger grains, sans plus.
En bouche, profile faro est modéré garde ce profile doux sucré avec un lambic faible de pomme allant presque sur le cidre. Pointe daigreur en bouche. Profile du lambic reste faiblard, bonne mais ans plus.
